title: Boris Johnson news live: PM's Brexit plan in ruins after Supreme Court decision
text:
The Supreme Court has ruled against Boris Johnson by declaring his government unlawfully shut down parliament for five weeks.

Speaker John Bercow said the Commons would return at 11.30am on Wednesday. Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn called for Mr Johnson to “consider his position” following the landmark decision, while Lib Dem leader Jo Swinson said he was “not fit” to be PM.

Speaking in New York, the prime minister said his government will “respect” the court verdict and added that “of course parliament will come back”.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.
description: The Supreme Court has ruled against Boris Johnson by declaring his government unlawfully shut down parliament for five weeks.
